pr_title: Add az namespace span attribute for App config

timeline.message: add az namespace span attribute on http
add az namespace span attribute on http

timeline.bodyText: Does this have to be hardcoded? Can this be made configurable instead?
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Can we include tracing in the name of this context key? This will make it clear as to what this key is used for. AZ_NAMESPACE is too generic.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,11 @@
      */
     String SPAN_BUILDER_KEY = "builder";
 
+    /**
+     * Key for {@link Context} which indicates that the context contains the Azure resource provider namespace.
+     */
+    String AZ_NAMESPACE_KEY = "az.namespace";

replies.bodyText:
but wouldn't coming from Tracer class help to understand that it is coming from tracing concepts.
I think it would repetitive to mention it in the variable name and class name too.
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: No, context is a property bag that is passed around quite a lot in all layers of our library. Having a key named az.namespace in context will not necessarily be clear as to what this namespace is and why it's used.
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: I think there is a slight mismatch in communication here. Srikanta is talking about the string "az.namespace", not the variable name "AZ_NAMESPACE_KEY" (despite the fact he used "AZ_NAMESPACE" in his comment). His argument is valid - imagine have a Map or a Context full of keys, one of which is "az.namespace" - it isn't clear where that came from or how it is relevant. If it had a more specific value then users might better infer that it is tracing related.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: Updated both the key and value to include tracing, i.e AZ_TRACING_NAMESPACE_KEY and az.tracing.namespace. The span attribute will still have the key az.namespace.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: How reliably can we determine whether the SwaggerInterfaceParser's serviceName will contain the expected names here? Instead within RestProxy could we retrieve the name of the package where the method exists and pass through an additional context value which will be a bit more robust compared to either a codegen name/hand-written name?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: I agree it does not seem like a reliable/easy to maintain way to determine resource provider namespace. Could each library set some common global variable? It should also be possible to fall back to default value (null ?) and don't set az.namespace attribute in this case eliminating libraries that don't support tracing
replies.author: lmolkova

replies.bodyText: I agree, this is fraught with danger. Let's find a better solution.
replies.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: Updated the approach to allow the client libraries to send in their respective Resource Provider Names to pass through the context object and skip the hand-written comparisons. Also, updated it to skip adding the attribute if az.namespace value isn't set.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: This is the OpenTelemetry package, should revert the comment renames.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should this add the attribute if the parsed name is ""? It appear in the policy it doesn't.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: updated it to not have the span attribute if it does not exist.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: call the other constructor from here instead of duplicating initialization code in both constructors.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: same here - call this create method from the other create overload method
timeline.author: srnagar

             restProxy);
     }

+     * @return a proxy implementation of the provided Swagger interface
+     */
+    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
+    public static <A> A create(Class<A> swaggerInterface, HttpPipeline httpPipeline, SerializerAdapter serializer,
+        TracerSpanAttributes tracerSpanAttributes) {
+        final SwaggerInterfaceParser interfaceParser = new SwaggerInterfaceParser(swaggerInterface, serializer);

timeline.bodyText:
Since this has just one attribute now, I am assuming new attributes will be added later. If that's the intent, then shouldn't we make this a fluent API? A public constructor with just one attribute now will result in breaking changes if we need more attributes here later.
Alternatively, do we need this attributes class, if all fields in here are going to be String types? Can we instead use Map<String, String> as properties bag?
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.core.util.tracing;
+
+/**
+ * Class to hold the attributes for tracer spans.
+ */
+public class TracerSpanAttributes {
+    private final String resourceProviderName;

replies.bodyText: Span attributes coming from clients would be expected to be strings and hence updating it to use a Map<String, String> instead.
replies.author: samvaity

-     *

-     */

-        return resourceProviderName;
-    }
-}
